remarks: The last few terms of a sequence that ends with all zeroes (or whatever the identity ` Z ` is for operation ` .+ ` ) are all the same. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jul-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-May-2014.)
statement:
seqid2.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. S ) -> ( x .+ Z ) = x ) $.
seqid2.2 $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
seqid2.3 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` K ) ) $.
seqid2.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( .+ , F ) ` K ) e. S ) $.
seqid2.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( ( K + 1 ) ... N ) ) -> ( F ` x ) = Z ) $.
seqid2 $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( .+ , F ) ` K ) = ( seq M ( .+ , F ) ` N ) ) $.
$d .+ x $.
$d F x $.
$d K x $.
$d M x $.
$d N x $.
$d S x $.
$d Z x $.
$d ph x $.
